Class TestUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intuit.wasabi.tests.library.util.TestUtils

extends Object
    Provides several static methods useful for the test classes.

      • relativeTimeString

        public static String relativeTimeString(int days)
        Returns the current time + days as a String formatted as needed.
        Parameters:
        days - the number of days relative to now
        Returns:
        a correctly formatted time String

      • getTimeString

        public static String getTimeString(Calendar cal)
        Returns the time given by cal as a String formatted as needed.
        Parameters:
        cal - the time to format
        Returns:
        a correctly formatted time String

      • wrapJsonIntoObject

        public static String wrapJsonIntoObject(String jsonString,
                                        String object)
        Wraps a JSON String into a JSON object. If the JSON String where str and the JSON object obj the resulting JSON String would be: {"obj":str}.
        Parameters:
        jsonString - the JSON String to wrap
        object - the object to wrap into
        Returns:
        the new JSON string

      • csvToJsonArray

        public static String csvToJsonArray(String csv,
                                    String fieldSeparator)
        Turns a csv with a header row into a JSON array.
        Parameters:
        csv - the csv string
        fieldSeparator - the column separators
        Returns:
        a String representing a JSON array

      • parseTime

        public static Calendar parseTime(String timestring)
                          throws ParseException
        Returns a calendar for the given time string. The time string should be formatted yyyy-MM-dd'T'hh:mm:ssZ, where Z is a literal (and stands for +0000). It is assumed to be in UTC.
        Parameters:
        timestring - the time string
        Returns:
        a calendar representing the date assumed to be UTC
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the time string is not correctly formatted.
